Nerangs.ab: tąn yazāi ǰīwām baxtan pad panǰ bār zōhr ud frāgām frāz ō ī barsom barišn xᵛāiš nāmə̄nīš pairicā jasāi
"At tąn yazāi, he should divide the ǰīwām and he has to bring in five occasions the zōhr and the frāgām to the barsom."
tąn yazāi ēn gyāg ǰām abāz baxšišn xᵛāiš nāmə̄nīš pairicā jasāi
"tąn yazāi at this passage, he has to divide the ǰām again (and continue with) nāmə̄nīš pairicā jasāi"

Quotations.ab: Cf. N28.44 Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2009 pp. 102-103:
pad ẏeŋ́hē mē aṣ̌āt̰ hacā jīw be baxšišn pad se bahr dō bahr ān ī zōhrag ud ēk ān ī barsom ay tāy ī *bastag kē az kust ī dašn-iš zōhrag pad-iš
At ẏeŋ́hē mē aṣ̌āt̰ hacāhe has to divide the jīwin three parts. Two parts are for the zōhrag and one for the barsom, that is, for the tied twigs at whose right side is the zōhrag
Cf. N84.1-8 Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2009 pp. 76-77; Cantera, 2014 pp. 211ff.:

ab.em: hapta həṇti hāuuanaiiō ratauuō barəsma stərənaēti paōiriia yeŋ́hē mē aṣ̌āt̰ hacā bitiiā ahunanąm vairiianąm θritiia dāidī mōi tūiriiā uštauuaitiiå vā spə̄ṇtā mainiiə̄uš vā hātōiš puxδa yeŋ́hē mē aṣ̌āt̰ hacā xštuuō dāidī mōi haptaθa uštauuaitiiå vā spə̄ṇtā mainiiə̄uš vā hātōiš
